articles.title: Belarus enters 'concerning' new phase in coronavirus outbreak: WHO official
articles.description: A World Health Organization (WHO) official on Saturday urged Belarus to impose new measures to contain the new coronavirus, out of concern that the outbreak in the country has entered a worrying new phase.
articles.content:
MINSK (Reuters) - A World Health Organization (WHO) official on Saturday urged Belarus to impose new measures to contain the new coronavirus, out of concern that the outbreak in the country has entered a worrying new phase.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Haas furlough UK staff, fifth F1 team to do so
articles.description: The U.S.-owned Haas Formula One team have furloughed most of their British-based employees, meaning half of the grid has now taken similar measures in response to the new coronavirus pandemic.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - The U.S.-owned Haas Formula One team have furloughed most of their British-based employees, meaning half of the grid has now taken similar measures in response to the new coronavirus pandemic.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Frodeno completes home Ironman triathlon for charity
articles.description: Olympic gold medallist Jan Frodeno completed a full Ironman triathlon in his home on Saturday to raise more than 200,000 euros ($217,280) for charity.
articles.content:
BERLIN (Reuters) - Olympic gold medallist Jan Frodeno completed a full Ironman triathlon in his home on Saturday to raise more than 200,000 euros ($217,280) for charity. 
The German, currently in coronavirus lockdown in Girona, Spain, swam 3.86km in his coun… [+1376 chars]

articles.title: Congo court denies bail to president's chief of staff in fraud probe

articles.title: Warehouse workers risk COVID-19 to ship Gucci shades, face cream, sofas
articles.description: As U.S. authorities ordered shutdowns of non-essential businesses to fight coronavirus, retailer Nordstrom Inc closed hundreds of stores and gave in-store workers three weeks' pay, calling their safety its top priority.

(Reuters) - As U.S. authorities ordered shutdowns of non-essential businesses to fight coronavirus, retailer Nordstrom Inc closed hundreds of stores and gave in-store workers three weeks’ pay, calling their safety its top priority.

articles.title: Kremlin says Moscow hospitals flooded as coronavirus death toll passes 100
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Saturday a "huge influx" of coronavirus patients was beginning to put a strain on hospitals in Moscow as Russia's death toll rose to more than 100.

articles.author: Maria Caspani
articles.title: UPDATE 2-Reaching grim milestone, United States logs world's highest coronavirus death toll
articles.description: The United States surpassed Italy on Saturday to become the country with the highest number of recorded coronavirus deaths, reporting more than 19,600 fatalities since the outbreak began, according to a Reuters tally.
articles.content:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - The United States surpassed Italy on Saturday to become the country with the highest number of recorded coronavirus deaths, reporting more than 19,600 fatalities since the outbreak began, according to a Reuters tally.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Oilers F Cave, 25, dies after suffering brain bleed
articles.description: Edmonton Oilers forward Colby Cave died Saturday morning, four days after having surgery to remove a colloid cyst that was causing pressure on his brain. He was 25.
articles.content:
Edmonton Oilers forward Colby Cave died Saturday morning, four days after having surgery to remove a colloid cyst that was causing pressure on his brain. He was 25. 
Cave’s wife, Emily, released a statement confirming the news.

articles.title: Congressional Republicans reject Democratic call for broader coronavirus relief
articles.description: The two top Republicans in the U.S. Congress vowed on Saturday to oppose Democrats' demands to boost a proposed $250 billion bill to aid small businesses during the coronavirus pandemic by adding money for hospitals and state and local governments.

articles.title: Coronavirus fight is a marathon not a sprint, top British doctor says
articles.description: The fight against the novel coronavirus is a marathon not a sprint and lifting the lockdown may involve drugs and not just vaccines, the medical director of England's national health service said on Saturday.
articles.content:

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Italy's daily coronavirus death toll and new cases push higher
articles.description: Deaths from the COVID-19 epidemic in Italy rose by 619 on Saturday, up from 570 the day before, and the number of new cases climbed to 4,694 from a previous 3,951.
articles.content:
ROME (Reuters) - Deaths from the COVID-19 epidemic in Italy rose by 619 on Saturday, up from 570 the day before, and the number of new cases climbed to 4,694 from a previous 3,951. 
The daily death toll was the highest since April 6 and the rise in infection… [+854 chars]
